author: Jack Liaw
text:
‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è Outstanding honesty and care from the staff!
I recently misplaced my iPad Pro at Anytime Fitness City Hall and thought it was gone for good. To my surprise, the staff kept it safe and returned it to me when I came back. Their honesty, professionalism, and genuine care for members truly deserve recognition. It‚Äôs rare to find such trustworthy people these days.
Thank you to the whole team for going above and beyond ‚Äî you‚Äôve earned my full respect and gratitude. Highly recommended gym with amazing people! üí™‚ú®
Thanks every AF cutyhall staff.

author: Karin Ng
text: one of my favourite gym!!! spacious with good & clean equipments. staffs are super friendly and nice as well. ++++ they have nutripod 10/10!!!!

author: Deckerz
text:
‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
A well-equipped and welcoming fitness space.

I've been really impressed with this Anytime Fitness location. The gym is well-maintained and offers a complete range of equipment to support any workout style. There's a full set of dumbbells, multiple pull-focused machines (I counted at least four), and a great selection of cardio machines that are almost always available‚Äîno waiting around even during peak hours.

Whether you're into strength training, cardio, or functional fitness, you'll find what you need here. The atmosphere is clean, organized, and conducive to a focused workout. Definitely one of the better Anytime Fitness branches I've visited.

author: Jerald Chong
text:
Extremely pleasant and satisfactory experience each and every visit with welcoming and friendly staff, clean and efficient equipment which are often well maintained in terms of usability and cleanliness.

Safety is always prioritised and strongly enforced to keep the welfare of the members in mind.

Really spacious gym, even during peak hours, where I am not required to necessarily wait long for equipment or share with that many people. Many mirrors and satisfactory lighting for those who are into taking aesthetic pics/vids.

Convenient location within citylink mall, with many nearby eateries and shopping options.

Definitely my go to gym of choice whenever I‚Äôm around town or done with work.

author: PZ C
text: I don't really know how to use gym equipment so all 5 stars in this review are primarily for Seed who teaches the Zumba class on Fridays at 7pm. His energy and exuberance is infectious, he brings an impressive array of dance and musical genres into the choreography and the class is welcoming to people of all levels, whether you're a regular with some dance background or a total newbie just looking to soak in the good vibes. I don't really have a preference for AF outlets since the machines are the same everywhere but it's the instructors who make all the difference. Thank you Seed for giving your all every class!

author: Jeryl Aw
text:
The place is very spacious, clean, well-maintained. Staff is very friendly and welcoming with each visit.

Location is very conveniently located at the central where there are ample amenities as well.

Anytime Fitness City Hall is my go-to outlet.

author: Adam Mcilroy
text: Af cityhall is one of the best gyms to use in singapore for strength training and bodybuilding. Staff are always friendly and ready to help. Gets crowded during the main peak timings (after office crowd) so best to hit it up outside of that timing to maximise your experience.

author: al√´na ong
text: One of the biggest AFs in Singapore, I reckon. Equipment selection is diverse and maintained accordingly. Accessible location, and helpful and cheerful staff. Only downsides here are the lack of access to sunlight as a gym in the basement and the insane crowds.

author: Alan Lim
text:
Had a very pleasant sign up with Hirda, been training with Leonard  since I joined and never look back.

Gym is spacious, clean, well-maintained. Staffs & trainers are very friendly.

Definitely one of the better Anytime Fitness branches I've visited.

author: jerome foo
text: AF City Hall is easily one of the best gyms I‚Äôve been to. The space is clean, well-maintained, and stocked with a wide variety of equipment that caters to all kinds of training ‚Äî whether strength, cardio, or functional. The location is super convenient as well!

author: Sihan Goi
text:
Update: Was just there earlier today for a morning workout. I was doing some clean and jerks, and it got a bit heavy so I dropped the bar from overhead. Note that this branch has bumper plates, spin bars, and platforms, i.e. equipment that are well suited for weightlifting. However, right before my last set, a gym staff came over and told me in a displeased manner "Sir, this is not a powerlifting gym", and told me that dumping the bar from overhead was not allowed. While I can understand gym rules (and I complied with it in my final set), the way and manner in which he brought it to my attention was no ideal. Also, there's quite a lot of unpack in his statement. First, I wasn't "powerlifting", I was "weightlifting. A gym staff who doesn't know the difference between the 2 sports doesn't instill a lot of confidence. Secondly, this gym has Eleiko powerlifting competition bars, so if it isn't a "powerlifting gym", i.e. it disallows powerlifting, I wonder why they bothered getting powerlifting equipment?

Minus 2 stars for the bad experience.

This is apparently the biggest AF in Singapore, and while it's big, it wasn't as huge as I expected, and isn't substantially bigger than, say, AF Pasir Panjang. Equipment wise, it's definitely well stocked. There's a warmup area with all kinds of warmup equipment (foam rollers, smfr balls, bands of various thicknesses, plyo boxes, light dumbbells, kettlebells, etc). I didn't take note of the machines too much, but the free weights area is also quite well equipped, with 3 half racks with attached platforms, another 3 full packs, Ziva hybrid bars and bumper plates, and a couple of Eleiko Pl bars. The platforms and bumper plates aren't the usual bouncy Hammer Strength ones, and don't look as new as the gym (maybe used elsewhere before?) but they also don't bounce as much, which helps with the noise. I also didn't see any specific warning against dumping the weights, so that's nice. Crowd wise, it was quite manageable on a Wednesday lunch time around 1 to 3pm. Was able to get the half rack and platform to myself. Shower facilities are also one of the better ones compared to other AF. Overall, a good place to train if in the area.

author: Jeryl Aw (BluntValor)
text: My experience here at City Hall AF has been very positive. The area is neat, centralised and maintained well. Will recommend this outlet!

author: LX Koh
text:
Been training with Leonard and he has been a great trainer and mentor. He‚Äôs a good listener and motivator. My life has changed for the better.

The equipment is well maintained and there is a huge selection. I‚Äôm not disappointed. The location is convenient and I have to admit I‚Äôm spoiled by the range of equipment. I can‚Äôt see myself going anywhere else.

Small note: please ensure there is enough moisturiser and deodorant in the female toilet, as they run out often.

author: Alexander Aaltonen
text:
Wow amazing gym, the biggest AF gym in Singapore! They pretty much got every machine and equipment you'd need for any workout!

Super spacious and well organized layout. Lighting is well planned too, which adds to the aesthetics and something out of the ordinary AF gym interiors you might find elsewhere.

I came on a Sunday early afternoon, so the crowd wasn't that bad. I'm sure weekdays after working hours might be worse.

Awesome gym. Will be back for sure!
üíúüñ§üîù

author: angelyn mok
text:
Firstly, i would like to compliment to awesome club mgr - Shamil, personal trainer - Hirda & Rasid, they‚Äôre very friendly, knowledgeable & patient in their coaching and took their time to explain each equipments.

Secondly, been member about 3 months, during lunch all Treadmill was fully occupied, have to wait about 20-30min, It is wasting time to rush down and waste money for keep paying member fee. As due to my health condition, for myself only can work on Treadmill, so i join AF@City Hall & also recommended by my CFO who is also member of AF.

Hope owner of AF increase the treadmill during peak hours or lunch.

author: I_Just_a Aiskajang
text: The male fitness coaches here are excellent and very friendly, and the gym is always tidy and clean. However, I feel that some of the female fitness coaches could work on being more polite and approachable. Improving their attitude would make the overall experience much better for everyone.

author: Justin Hoyo
text:
This is definitely my favourite anytime fitness in Singapore! Extremely spacious, equipments are well-maintained, facilities are clean, abundant power racks (8 power racks in total and 3 deadlift platforms!), dumbbells go up to 60kg, etc‚Ä¶

Given that it is situated in town area, it can get pretty crowded after 6pm, so be prepared. But in the weekends, it‚Äôs generally quite empty!

author: Hana Leong
text: City Hall AF‚Äôs got such a great space and solid equipment range, and always a good energy fro the crowd. But the adductor and abductor machines have been out of order for over a month now, and it looks like another leg machine‚Äôs joined the holiday. Maybe they‚Äôre just waiting to complete the ‚Äúleg day outage‚Äù collection before fixing them all at once.

author: jonathan low
text:
There are many Anytime Fitness gyms in Singapore, but having a great one in such a central location at City Hall is a real plus. The gym is spacious, clean, and well-maintained with a good range of equipment for both strength and cardio. The atmosphere is welcoming, and members are generally polite and considerate. The staff and trainers do an excellent job of keeping the environment positive, so both regulars and first-timers feel comfortable training here.

I personally train with Affandy, and the experience has been fantastic. He not only pushes me to improve physically, but also takes the time to check on overall wellbeing‚Äîthings like nutrition, recovery, and stress management. Having a trainer who genuinely cares makes a big difference, and it keeps me motivated to stay consistent.

5 stars for Anytime Fitness City Hall, and definitely 5 stars for Affandy!

author: Jeremy Chan
text:
This is the 1st time I‚Äôve been this gym & just entering it blew my mind away! This gym can compete with the Chai Chee branch IMO. Albeit the Chai Chee one has a few less common equipment, this gym definitely has more than the other Anytime Fitness(apart from Chai Chee, they are on par) gyms in Singapore.

The equipment, machines, free weights etc. are all pretty much brand new & in pristine condition. If I had to decide whether this or the Chai Chee branch were my favorite AF gyms in Singapore I would be extremely hard pressed to choose. The are both @ the top for me. Top 3 AF gyms in Singapore are City Hall, Chai Chee, & then Geylang Central. In order expect for the top 2 where I am unable to decide, lol.

*Update* : After being to both this City Hall & Chai Chee AFs a few more times again. I‚Äôd like to mention that IMO, City Hall is now the clear winner & would be @ the top of my list of best AF gyms in SG. You have designated toilets/showers for both genders, & a staff consisting of some veteran trainers. Apparently the gym gets crazy packed during peak hours though, so y‚Äôall might wanna watch out for that. I go usually during early to mid afternoons & there are more people than other AF gyms even during those hours. Hope all these info helps!

author: Junda Jd
text:
Been working out with them ever since they opened. Huge area with a great layout and good choice of equipments.

Toilets are regularly cleaned.

Staffs are friendly, music is great and they are constantly trying to improve on what they can.

Faulty equipments/wear and tear gets turned over really quickly.

Thanks guys!

author: Benedict Chan
text:
Equipment üèãüèø‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüèãüèø‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüèãüèø‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüèãüèø‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüèãüèø‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è
Cleanliness üêõ üêõ üêõ
Crowd üë•üë•üë•üë•üë•
Facilities üèõÔ∏èüèõÔ∏èüèõÔ∏èüèõÔ∏èüèõÔ∏è
Spot üÖøÔ∏è üÖøÔ∏è üÖøÔ∏è üÖøÔ∏è
Overall üèÜ üèÜ üèÜ üèÜ

Biggest AF in SG - possibly. Most generous equipments - possibly. 3 to 4 deadlift stations and racks. Include a wheel to flip too. Loads of cardio machines (but why?). Got a spacious studio for classes. Stretching/TRX corner tad small for big gym.

Crowd is lively - mainly youngsters from nearby uni or schools. Alot there to socialize.

Good if you're there to social but may not be great to train as groupies hang out here.

Restroom and shower a little messy and not that clean compared to other AFs IMO.

Good for those who wants a social place for motivation to work out or right in heart of town.

author: Candice Judith
text:
Been an AF member for nearly two years, was at a different gym prior and am currently working in the fitness industry. I recently started going to the City Hall gym more regularly.

At peak hours this specific trainer would hog 3 machines/stations for a client and making it inaccessible/inconvenient for other members, and when others would enter the unused stations we would be disallowed even if they weren‚Äôt in active use:

1.) laying out the mat in high traffic areas or in front of/next to machines disrupting access, 2) tying resistance bands on machines and not allowing others to use said machine.

My partner has once asked this trainer if he could use a machine (since there was no one on it) to which he begrudgingly said he was using. Again, there was no one on it.

A recent visit on 9/20 (1.20pm) left a bitter feeling after my interaction with this trainer. He was at the purple mat area with the battle ropes laid out, half-bosu and foam roller. I asked if he was still using the bosu ball (at this point he‚Äôs coaching his client how to use the battle ropes), and while he handed the half-bosu to my direction he dropped it on the ground before I got a grip on it. It felt like this was a deliberate move because I had entered his space.

The gym is supposed to be a welcoming space for all bodies and individuals. As an AF trainer representing the brand, this is not the kind of environment that I associate with the Anytime Fitness brand.

author: Edwin Xie
text:
One of the best well-equipped AF gyms in Singapore!
Love the huge space !

author: Geraldine Lim
text: Probably one of the most well equipped and also the largest AF. I love coming here for legs days cos the machines are well maintained!

author: Joey Joanne Chua
text: I've been training with Leonard Chua and I can confidently say he's a highly professional fitness coach. He‚Äôs knowledgeable, attentive, and always tailors the sessions to fit my goals and abilities. Leonard‚Äôs guidance and motivation have helped me improve both my technique and overall fitness. I truly appreciate his dedication and would highly recommend him to anyone looking for a skilled and committed personal trainer.

author: kyle
text: great gym! the amenities are well kept and there‚Äôs a wide variety of machines. all of the trainers are friendly and welcoming, and ready to help! i‚Äôve been training with PT Affandy and i would 100% recommend. his training is very meticulous; he takes into account your skill level and any issues and creates well rounded routines, gradually building up your skill!

author: Meng Choong Low
text: Solid gym ‚Äî clean, convenient, and never too crowded. Staff are always friendly and welcoming!

author: Abin Baby Samuel
text: This gym is an amazing facility with almost every equipment you need. It‚Äôs Indeed the biggest in SingaporeüíØand the staff is very friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this gym to anyone looking for a great workout.üíØüî•üí™üèº ‚Ä¶

author: Hello Ang
text:
Your policy states:

‚ÄúWhen you are a part of the Anytime Fitness family, you can work out at gyms nationwide AND around the globe thanks to our worldwide club access. Think of it as a global membership plan.‚Äù

But your staff denied me access when I was on vacation in Singapore over the long weekend and tried to access the gym with my keyfob. Your staff said that international keyfob is not accepted at this branch ‚Äî which is against your own policy?

Ps. I was in Malaysia and Japan earlier this year and the access worked just fine.

author: Katherine
text:
I gave 5 stars as I enjoy training at City Link until my recent‚Äôs training when a member refused to share the smith machine.  A lady was using a bench doing her exercises and left the smith machine unused most of the time.  Initially I informed her that I would trained after her but she was unhappy and told me to use other machines as she would be long.  I then used the leg press next to the smith machine.  Seeing that she didn‚Äôt use the smith machine most of the time and after I completed my exercise I asked her whether I could share the smith machine.  She refused to share and asked me to use other machines again.  I told her that I could use the smith machine when she finished her set but she just simply very stubborn and refused to share.  She asked who am I to tell her and asked me to get the Manager to talk to her.  With this kind  attitude and whereever she goes she will not be willing to share.

I then approached the staff for help.  Despite staff‚Äôs intervention she still refused to listen. The lady then told the staff that the more I talked the longer I had to wait to use the machine.

What is the purpose of printing wordings on the wall asking members please share the machines?

How can we allow member be so selfish?

What actions will the owner take against the member?

Thank you

author: khrhms
text: Huge AF gym and probably one of the biggest in Singapore. Located at the City Link Mall, at the walkway between Raffles City Shopping Centre and Marina Square. Clean and new machines. Spacious for your body weight workout as well. Will definitely come more often. Shower facilities available as well.

author: James IWC
text: This gym has a good variety of equipment, the staff are very knowledgeable, and friendly. I highly recommend!

author: R H
text: Popular location, but customer service is practically non-existent. It‚Äôs clear they don‚Äôt feel the need to try as the place will stay full no matter how poorly they treat members. Emails go unanswered, and the front desk staff might as well not be there. It‚Äôs functional, but the overall experience is flat and unwelcoming. Won‚Äôt be returning.

author: PL Ow
text: I love the classes offered at the club, all are conducted by wonderful trainers, namely Josephine for yoga, Ruth for mobility pilates, Eka for Pilates  & Leonard for Inferno HIIT. The space & the vibe of the club are plus points too.

author: Owen Low
text:
Honestly I really like this gym.
- Equipments are well maintained
- It's spacious and in the mornings the gym is pretty empty which is nice

However one area of improvement, not a fan that the evolut body scanning is inside the staff room.

I understand that there needs to be staff supervision, but I've had instances where the staff outright refused to let me use, even while they're in the room. Not all staff, there's one in particular that doesn't bother.

It's also an issue when there's no staff available, so it's hard to keep track when I need to scan.

Hopefully we can either move the machine out or some other way for members to access it easily

author: Clarissa Poon
text: Absolutely my favourite outlet! The staff are friendly and the space is well utilised. Always looking forward to gymming here üíÉü•∞ ‚Ä¶

author: Angelina Wong
text: one of my favourite AF. The gym is huge and super well equipped. Manager & staffs are rly friendly too!!

author: Peter Caged
text: I had a very we experience where staff asked me to share gym equipment with him during evening hours. While it is acceptable to share equipment with fellow members, I would advise staff to designate non-peak hours for this purpose. Very uncomfortable experience.

author: Tydir W
text:
Large, very well equipped gym in the heart of the city. I‚Äôd expect that this gym gets pretty dang crowded on weekday evenings, due to its prime location.

Large enclosed area for classes, small area for stretching. I wish I hand known the mats were at a different spot away from the stretching area. Ample lockers, including more lockers inside the changing rooms. Showers were clean when I visited on a Sunday afternoon.

Great music choice too.

author: Nur Asmanee
text: The gym very nice. the staff here, sya & huiting were really friendly too.

author: Nadia Dawood
text:
Gym and equipment is nice, cos everything is new. Some great machines available as well.
Very spacious, cld mostly get to workout without waiting too late even during peak hours. But it‚Äôs super super crowded during the after-work peak.
Also - AF City Hall Management - pls look into the women‚Äôs restroom - all the shower stalls smell VERY badly of pee. Even just stepping into the restrooms, it smells really badly. Are u guys cleaning it with Dettol or disinfectant, cos the pee smell was so bad I walked out a second after stepping into a stall to change. It was disgusting.
Never experienced any AF branch restroom that smelled this bad.

author: Zamiq A.
text: The PTs (Hui Ting and Hirda) and the club manager are very nice and friendly. Highly recommend them because they really make the gym a wonderful place to be at.

author: Cheng Wei Lee
text:
Spacious and well-equipped gym in a modern environment- one of my favourite gyms in Singapore! Also love the cool (but quiet) vibes. Has the basic machines and equipment and much more, maybe just missing some a sled.

Been training with my PT Leonard Chua and needless to say, he is the best. Every session is different, fun and challenging!

author: Clarissa Poon
text:
This gym absolutely spoiled me with the equipment and space. The team is bubbly and friendly too. Love to yap their ears off ya~
Will definitely come back here!

author: Aye Chan Myae
text: I‚Äôve been training with Senior PT Leonard for almost two years, and the results have been fantastic! His experience truly shows; he knows exactly which muscles to target and tailors each session to maximize progress. The gym itself is well-equipped with a wide variety of versatile machines and tools, which allows us to switch up workouts and keep things challenging. Not only does Leonard push me to do my best, but he also ensures I‚Äôm working out safely and effectively. If you‚Äôre looking for a knowledgeable trainer who will help you see real results, I highly recommend Leonard.

author: dan ng
text: Great Gym with good machines matched by friendly staff. Good energy to work out here. Keep it up.

author: Ryan Poon
text: Spacious, clean, wide variety of machines and friendly staff! The better AF for sure.

author: Kelly Tee
text: The Anytime Fitness City hall is clean and neat. They have awesome coach, Leonard. He is kind and experienced, guided me with the proper use of the gym equipments and training. I highly recommend this if you want to be fit and strong!

author: chua min min
text: Big gym definitely but sanitary has always been a little bit concerning. From the musky smell in toilet to spotting a cockroach around the benches... Good equipment but I'm hesitating to return.

author: P N
text: Too busy at times I wanted to go, and not nice shower/locker facilities. Yes it‚Äôs cheaper but the gap in quality is bigger than the gap in price vs virgin or pure

author: Tarik Sahin
text: Visited three different AF gyms while in Singapore, AF City Hall was by far the most spacious, with a great atmosphere

author: Aqil Johari
text: smooth sign up process with hirda! thank you so much and looking forward to working out at the gym :)

author: Lucinda Lee
text: 24h no use, when i went the malls are alr closed at 2am on a Saturday and cant even use any citylink to get near AF

author: David Lim
text: Love the gym, constant user and always enjoy the experience inside!

author: Francisco de Torres Jr.
text: This AF outlet is one of the nicest, cleanest and welcoming gym I experience so far. Ample space for all the equipments. Yoga / Boxing area has limited space that is good for small group class. All equipments are still in good condition, as it open last quarter of 2023. All the best to City square AF team.

author: Vincent Lbd
text: Very good experience, good equipment and Leo is really nice coach!

author: Reean Chuang
text: Good gym nice place to workout at!

author: Alex Martin
text:
Calibre of gym user is higher than my usual gym. I was probably the smallest guy there. As other reviews say - lots of equipment means very little need to alter my workout plan significantly. Vending machine was low on stuff but minor thing.

Bathroom is spacious w good shower facilities and sufficient lockers / cubbies.

author: Brenda Jansen
text: Tried out a few PT sessions with Hirda, a personal trainer at AF City Hall, and she was very knowledgeable, friendly and patient in her coaching. The program for each session was personalized and effective, and she took the time to explain each movement and form and suggested new exercises tailored to the muscle groups I wanted to work on. Highly recommend if you‚Äôre looking for someone to help you achieve your fitness goals.

author: Liza R
text:
Anytime Fitness@CityHall. Great gym with plenty of space. It‚Äôs always clean and well-maintained.
Thanks to my Personal Trainer, Hirda who i've been working out with. She customizes every session to fit my goals, motivating me effectively to enhance my performance without making me feel too pressured. I‚Äôve noticed a remarkable improvement in both my strength and stamina. ü§ó
For thoes who are seeking for a personal trainer. I highly recommend, Hirda!

author: Abigail Grace
text: Thank you Hirda for the personal training session! Very professional and friendly and taught me on the details for the strength training I needed thank you! AF City Hall music and equipments and people here are super fit too which makes you extra motivated for your goals üí™üí™üí™üí™üí™ ‚Ä¶

author: Carla Abanes
text: great group classes, i always try to join the body combat class every saturday morning.

author: Reza Mahsuri
text: Walked in into the gym where everyone is talking about and it amazes me on how big it was with nice lighting and great atmosphere, fully equipped with aesthetic looking equipments. The staffs was very friendly and shout out to one of the staffs wearing the specs who professionally took me for the gym tour with a warm welcoming gesture throughout. Kudos to the gym and staffs for this wonderful experience!!!

author: yung cloudz99
text: Spacious and Big! Friendly and welcoming staff! Highly recommended!

author: Spartan Dan
text:
There's a reason why they call this the biggest AF in SG. Literally loads of squat rack, deadlift platform, machines and weights. Workout wise you are literally spoiled for choices. Would have given a 5 star if it's not for an unpleasant experience with a staff.

Usually the lat pulldown machine there will be an extra weight to stack like either 5 or 10lbs if for etc
U want 170lbs, but the stack weights is from 160lbs then next 180lbs
So there's no option for that I decided to take a 10pound weight plate to stack with the pin.

I know it's not the usual right thing but other AF I did it's okay so I didn't know for this one. A staff pass by a just tell me
"Hey cannot do this ah. Take out take out!" And walk away

I said I'm sorry he just turn behind and gave me an unpleasant look.

It does give me a bad feeling for a while but I just finish through my workout.

So doesn't mean the biggest AF in SG comes with the best experience ah.

Given the opportunity maybe I'll come but town area. I hate the town crowd and stuck up people. So I'll stick to the heartland AFs.

author: Haqqul Azmi
text:
This gym is at a very convenient place and easy to find. My jaw seriously dropped when I saw how massive this place was. Nice atmosphere with a very wide variety of equipment. Was reading the other reviews and I personally don't see the problem with a place being too "ameteurish" (if that even is a thing). Everyone there had a friendly vibe and was working on themselves.
Definitely one of the best af's in Singapore. Will be coming here again üòÅüòÅ

author: Nigel Lim
text:
Not my home gym.

But the space here is huge with a myriad of machines and equipment to cover your every need.

Staff was very nice and sincere to offer a helping hand as well.

11/10 will recommend for the vibes and tools.

not sure about the pricing now - so the recommendation does not cover this.

--

Oh! But if the toilets can be kept dry for people to change out - it will be great! (i.e. for those that prefers to use the cubicles - the toilet bowl cubicle is somehow perpetually wet) - just a small thing.

author: JW Yeo
text:
I think I have to be a bit objective here:

1. I love this outlet because of the size, extensive collection of work out fixtures, machines and other equipment.
2. The staff are very helpful and friendly .
3. But having been to many AFs around the island, the powerlifter hogging, entitled children tiptokking, and gossipy atmosphere persists.
4. I know physique, muscle mass, and looking svelte is more important than ever in the Social Media age. But being rude and obnoxious is not "Alpha." Most of these children wouldn't be able to afford any of the membership fees or the 300.dollar designer sneakers without parental assistance. I don't think working professionals should pay to feel as if they're second-rate customers because a posse of rich kids like to show off their "muscled" after one rep.
5. I really like coming to this branch because of the size and urban location. But honestly, I am just entirely giving up on Anytime Fitness. This is beyond childish. The staff do their best, but the company's management let's them down. And it's let the customers down as well.

author: Jim Lee
text:
Clean, spacious and friendly staff!

One suggestion is to add a shoulder-pad hack squat/or a pendulum squat, would visit way more often on leg days if the gym has these!

author: The InvisibleGaijin
text:
Fantastic gym experience in Singapore. Mostly positive experience with some room for improvement. Very spacious with a huuuge variety of machines that offer full body workout if you prefer a safe and more stable workout compared to free weights. The weights available also go beyond what other AF outlets offer. Side note: I don't think having "amateurish" gym goers should affect anyone's gym experience. Everyone has a  different starting point.

I really love the variety of machines that work the back muscles, but did wish there was a lateral raise machine for shoulders.
The air con isn't as powerful as I'd like and the toilet sinks did not have soap loaded. Also wished there was wet wipe dispenser instead of the dry paper towel and spray option. Overall still an outlet I would recommend for a solid workout pump.

author: Nurul Rizal
text: A really nice and spacious gym with very nice and polite staffs

author: Joel Chong
text:
Outstanding gym with many amazing pieces and high spec equipment. Staff were friendly, gym is well thought out and clean with anything you could ever want.

Great for powerlifters, just note no chalk allowed

Got told off by a rude member here but that‚Äôs not the fault of the establishment or the staff. 100% highly recommended!

author: Hairul Aidil
text: Inept management. And gym users not reporting to staff working in the floor with issues and going straight to management. Also gym management lacking the bigger picture of managing expectations of gym users experience. Can buy 2 Eleiko bars but can't buy the other specialty bars for the gym users.

author: Joyce Lim
text: Affandy has been my PT for more than a year now. I really appreciate him for being 100% committed in my fitness journey. He is ready for every session, and finds many ways to meet my goals. Nothing fancy, but discipline and consistency with him every session. Thank you!

author: Greg Hamer
text: Best Anytime Fitness I‚Äôve been to anywhere in the world. Big, clean, spacious, great selection of machines. It was a bit hard to find but got there with directions. Thank you!

author: yk
text: Gym has great equipment, overall space and great music too. However, an experience with one of the staff has led me to believe that he / she could definitely benefit from a little hospitality  lesson with the way they speak to patrons. For eg, the way they request gym users to ‚ÄúKindly‚Äù put their weights back can be extremely rude and calls for some better use of tone and selection of words.

author: Zulhusni

text: Great atmosphere and environment! I enjoyed my PT sessions with Hirda who was attentive, knowledgeable and super encouraging throughout my strength training sessions. I've learned alot from her and grew to love working out even more. Thank you Hirda üòäüòä ‚Ä¶

text: I‚Äôve been joined as member 2 months at city hall , there is one of trainer‚Äôs Leonard , he was amazing trainer ,after 2 months i got improved my body by him ..now i planning to take more  section train with him to be soon .. thanks Leonard, i really appreciate it .. üôèüôèüôè ‚Ä¶

author: laksh man
text: a very good solid 10/10 & spacious gym top notch facilities & even the toilet, place & equipment is very clean. highly recommend to gym here. However I wish the staffs working there can be more welcoming & look less fierce..

author: Nurhana Hafiz
text: The biggest AF in SG, boasting some of the best equipment in a large, conducive space. Super love the shower facilities and the cool restroom. The different classes offered in a spacious studio cater to members‚Äô different. Interests. The crew is helpful and friendly. Location is accessible and post- workout food options are many. One of the best AFs in SG. Thank you for existing!

author: Dev Bhatt
text:
Disclaimer: These opinions are purely my own. I'm just your regular gym enthusiast. Although my usual spot is a different Anytime Fitness outlet owned by the same incredible owner, I've experienced his dedication, passion for the industry and eye for detail first-hand.

Stepping into the Anytime Fitness at City Hall is like taking a breath of fresh air. It's not just a gym ‚Äì it's an experience. The ambiance here is unparalleled, inviting and full of energetic vibes that push you to achieve that extra rep or mile.

When it comes to equipment, let's just say it's evident that quality wasn't compromised. Each machine feels like it's top-notch, catering to every muscle group you want to work on. No more waiting for that one popular machine; they've got you covered!

But, it's not just the machines that make a gym. The heart of this place lies with its staff. I have seldom come across such a friendly and accommodating team, always eager to assist and make your gym experience worth every drop of sweat.

Price? Competitive doesn't even begin to cover it. To all those who're shelling out big bucks at other "big brand" gyms, I have just one thing to say: Do yourself a favour and check out Anytime Fitness City Hall. Your wallet and your muscles will thank you.

Lastly, a massive shoutout to the entire team of Anytime Fitness City Hall - you guys are the real MVPs, making every gym-goer's journey smoother and more enjoyable. Wishing you all the success (and gains) in the world!

author: Maria Zimovich
text:
Excellent gym! It's brand new, huge, very clean, and with a massive range of top-notch equipment. What's even better is that they offer classes not just in the evening but also during the noon hours, making it super convenient for people with slightly different working schedules and freelancers like myself.
I just wish I lived a bit closer to the area to fully take advantage of it. There's one class that makes the one-hour MRT ride to City Hall absolutely worth it ‚Äì Monday's noon MetCon with Hirda. She brings fantastic energy and motivation to the sessions, the class is challenging in all the right ways and will surely push you to your limits. Long way to go, but I'm feeling stronger with every session!

author: carlo moltoni
text: The staff at this gym were very pleasent and helpful

author: Zoe Tang
text: Hirda is an exceptional and easy-going personal trainer. Her sessions are efficient, personalized, and truly effective. With her guidance, i enjoyed every step of the journey. Highly recommended for anyone serious about getting fit.

author: Jesse Adam
text:
One of the worst Anytime Fitness in Singapore. The only thing it has going is its size. The male toilet is dominated with people posing without a care in the world of others needing to use the toilet, and the very obvious injections going on in there. No one, absolutely no one, reracks or cleans the equipment after use. It is almost impossible to use any machine without some kid chasing you away from a mile away saying "I'm reserving this machine". Kids hogging the machines and benches by sitting there using their phone, picking a fight with you when you ask to share or simply asking "how many sets do you have left?". The very very obvious bias to attract influencers who come and go where the money takes them without a care in the world for regular, proper, well-mannered gym-goers. The lack of proper reinforcement of good gym etiquette such as reracking and cleaning the equipment after use like how Anytime Fitness Tanjong Pagar does.

All in all, 0 star. Will never recommend anyone who genuinely wants a place to work out to come here unless the pain they enjoy is mental pain and/or just trying to look for a fight with the kids who go there.

author: Jet Lin
text: I don't normally review AF gyms but this gym is the or among the best AF in Singapore. Big, spacious, many barbell stations to use. And one more thing that I wouldn't thought will be a plus factor is the MUSIC. It's the only gym where I don't bring my own headphones as the music is fire. It's EDM remix of popular songs from a wide range of artists, when I was there today I heard remix of ratm/queen/ACDC/MCR/nirvana/snoop dog/ dr Dre among many others. And the amazing thing is that the music has a seamless transition to the next song. Feels like I'm at a edm concert it's really wild

author: Clarissa Lim
text: I chance upon a free trial session with Hirda, a personal trainer at AFCH. Every exercise was explained to me clearly, with a focus on proper form and technique, ensuring I got the most out of each movement! If you're looking for a personal trainer who is not only knowledgeable but also friendly, approachable, and dedicated to helping you succeed, I highly recommend you to look for her.

author: Florian Parzhuber
text: Huge gym. I believe this is the largest gym in Singapore. Amazing.

author: Brian Claus
text: Unhelpful staff. I brought a problem related to my membership to their attention, the staff confirmed it was a problem after looking at my membership in their system and then refused to take care of it, telling me I had to send an email to someone else to get it looked at. Not sure why they expect me to spend my time chasing their organization over a problem they created.

author: Mohd Firdaus
text: An amazing gym and good atmosphere as well as the trainer and staff there

author: Yaz Mohd
text:
Huge space, no need to feel like running an obstacle course when getting from one equipment to another.

Friendly staff!

Most importantly, I felt welcome there. Did not feel out of place coz I am not a super serious gym-goer/bodybuilder/weight lifter type. üòÅ

Just a little note though. Perhaps there could be more than 1 water cooler for such a big space?

author: Syakir Akmal
text: Very clean and good place for training. Spacious and lots of equipment that to offer. Most of my workout programme had been done smoothly without any wait also. Keep it up for maintain the cleanliness and the vibes also!

author: En kai
text: I would like to compliment Shamil for patiently touring me around the gym with detailed explanations and being professional to handle my queries where made me sign up the membership within 30 mins

author: Shihao Foo
text:
Pros:
- Big, spacious and clean.
- Friendly staff.
- Interesting and uncommon equipment such as the tyre-flipping machine and the booty builder.
- If you are into classes, its class area is the biggest I have seen for an AF.

Cons:
- Does not allow use of regular plates at deadlift area - only bumper plates allowed, even if the first plate is a bumper plate such that the regular plates don't touch the ground.
- The smallest regular plate is 5kg. Combined with the preceding point, this means one would only be able to add weights at 10kg intervals for deadlifts, because you can't use the 1.25kg and 2.5kg regular plates.
- No chalk (whether regular or liquid) allowed.

Overall, a good gym for users who don't need chalk and don't deadlift.

author: Victor Lim
text: Facility looks amazing and the staff are very welcoming

author: KS Chen
text: Open so long but No new machine. Boring

author: Pearl Fitriah
text:
The gym is spacious and variety of equipments to use.

Staffs are friendly and helpful when needed assistance.

Always a good vibe when working out with great song choices.

author: Benjamin Hills
text: Decent gym and size however my past two experiences going to this gym have really been affected due to the rude way I was talked to by staff. When customer facing you would expect some form of respect or basic courtesy which I did not experience. Very disappointed.

text: Free wifi, perfect when I need to take a quick call or just finish up some work before my work out. On top of that all staffs are super friendly and helpful!!! The place is also thoroughly cleaned everyday. The cleaner cleans the female toilet every day during noon!

author: t
text: I went there during the day, but it was crowded. I gave up going in. I thought it would be less crowded, so I went there late at night, but I couldn't find the entrance to the basement because it was late at night, so I gave up again. I wonder if this place is not open 24 hours a day. I would like to know how to get in late at night.

author: Ryezal Rahim
text:
Hi Ryezal Rahim,

We're sorry to hear about your experience.
We noticed you rated us 1 star, and we truly apologize if your visit didn‚Äôt meet your expectations. We‚Äôd really appreciate it if you could drop us a quick message to let us know what went wrong. Your feedback helps us improve. Thank you!

Thank you for the 5-star review!

Hi Yu Kun Woo,

author: Hairul Aidil Fadzlee Bin Mohamad Kasim
text:
Hi Hairul,

We understand your membership has been revoked but know that our gym is committed to providing a safe and comfortable environment for all members. Unfortunately, we have multiple complains and feedbacks especially from female members regarding your behaviour and also from Anytime Fitness HQ regarding ongoing investigation pointing to similar incidents. We take these matters very seriously and must uphold our policies to ensure the well-being of everyone.
